text: Abdul Nassar is the second Keralite who climbed Mount Everest, a native of Peringodan House from Nedungottur, Thiruvegappura, near Pattambi in Palakkad district of Kerala State. == Mount Everest Mission == He climbed Mount Everest on 16 May, 2019. They started the Mount Everest mission on 17th April 2019, and two of the 26 men team from Spain, Italy, United States, Australia and the UK, along with Abdul Nasser, died before reaching their destination. Abdul Nassar and his team successfully reached the summit of Mount Everest in 30 days, climbing up to 29,029 feet in 30 days to overcome the adverse weather conditions of the mountain. == Achievements == He completed Ironman in 2018 in Malaysia. Abdul Nassar earned Ironman's title by completing the triathlon in 14 hours and 57 minutes. He also participated in the Ironman 70.3 competition in Colombo, Sri Lanka. Also he participated in many Marathon races around the world including Paris Marathon. Abdul Nasser received the Qatar Indian Embassy Sports Excellence Award in 2018. He has also published his story, the book named The Roadless Travelled . == Personal life == Abdul Nasser is the son of P Kunhahammed Musliyar and Nafisa, a scholar and Samastha Palakkad District Vice President and Professor of Markaz Arabic College, Kartala, Valancheri. He graduated in Commerce subject from Sree Neelakanta Government Sanskrit College Pattambi . He is currently working as a Chartered Accountant at Qatar Petroleum. ==See also== *Indian summiters of Mount Everest - Year wise *List of Mount Everest summiters by number of times to the summit *List of Mount Everest records of India *List of Mount Everest records == References == Category:1976 births Category:Living people Category:Indian summiters of Mount Everest
title: Abdul Nassar
